Reviews.Title: “Great city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: sallywatkins44
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful weekend in Paris and the Hotel Duret perfectly suited us. The staff were very welcoming and the hotel was an excellent choice - very modern, clean, quiet and bright. We had booked a superior room (101) which was a good size by Paris standards, particularly large bathroom and king bed and an large walk in wardrobe and desk area. There was a small flatscreen TV in the room with mostly French channels but did have Sky News. The room was very clean, great decor and bedlinen and situated just 2 mins walk from Argentine metro so really well positioned. A few steps away at the end of the road are some typical Parisien restaurants which are great for breakfast (priced from Euro 7.50), reasonably priced casual meals and coffee etc. and a buzzy atmosphere. There is also a very nice patisserie there so don't take breakfast at the hotel at Euros 18! The hotel is on a very quiet street so feels nice and tucked away, but the Arc de Triomphe is just 5 minutes walk away and the fabulous walk down the Champs Elysees so close. The Metro so easily accessible from the hotel and a very direct line for the main areas but Paris is a great city to walk around and the walk to the Eiffel is around 25 minutes and the same to the Tuilleries. All in all I highly recommend this hotel for a city break. We got a great deal on Expedia so watch out for deals as the rack rate of 270 Euros a night is definitely over the top....as most other things are in this wonderful but expensive city!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Andrew B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. Clean, modern, well located (walking distance to the very centre of Paris!) and with very friendly and helpful staff. Only criticism is that the rooms are probably the smallest hotel rooms I've ever seen. All other factors make up for this however, but would still have liked a little more space. Would definitely stay again and recommend to anyone and everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Still a recommendable choice”
Reviews.Author: jnha
Reviews.Content: A small and nice boutique hotel, well located near l'Etoile. Rather modern decor in the rooms, and in the rest of the property. Staff extremely pleasant and efficient. For Paris standards, the rates are reasonable, even if one can think they are somehow high. Beds are excellent and the bathroom amenities quite OK in terms of quality and replenishment rate. There is a not-so-difficult-to-operate safe in each bedroom. Some rooms are not so small and have a balcony. There is no specific view, except a typical Parisian street, which is nice for those who want to feel as a local. Very recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Minijellybaby
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in November 2011 on a short city break to Paris for both our first time in the city. From reading about hotels in the city and the room sizes being small we were very happy to find the room was a good size. We stayed in room 602. The room was clean and had an ensuite bathroom with the toilet in a separate room. It was a bit rough around the edges and the wall paint was coming off in places and some of the sockets in the room did not work but don't let this put you off the hotel was in a great location and very near the metro to enable you to travel round Paris easy. It is also very near the stops for the buses to the airport. The only tips I have are to think twice about the room service we ordered a few things that looked very appealing on the menu as we were very hungry after a long plane delay in the uk and a later than planned arrival. What was delivered looked and tasted .. Well ...cardboard like ! We got stung for the privilege .. 68 euros! There is an amazing bakery literally at the end of the street the food costs next to nothing and was amazing ! All fresh and the staff were all very helpful. The other tip I have is to make your requests very clear to the reception at the hotel. My partner and I wanted to watch the Moulin rouge but the reception booked us in to the wrong show and told us the wrong time! They did refund us but if u only have one night to go then I suggest you do double check or go and buy tickets direct from the place! Overall we had a great time in Paris and the hotel was satisfactory for our needs as it was just a base. I would not recommend this if you want a weekend where you intend to spend long periods in the hotel as I would have been very disappointed had this have been the case.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel...cleanliness could improve...”
Reviews.Author: DannyKaz
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel, frendly staff, located away from touristy area but but still just few minutes form Arc de Triomphe and shopping av.des Champs-Élysées. Only downside was room wasn't cleaned properly had stain from a glass on the table and dust on lamps. Also breakfast waiter was grumpy and unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emma099
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel Duret for two nights for my 21st birthday. The hotel is lovely,the decor outside and inside is gorgeous,very modern and clean. The room we had was on the 2nd floor. It was very nice,we had a small balcony which was a nice added extra. The room was very clean,had a safe which you could have the use of for free. The staff at the hotel are so friendly,at check in they provide a map and are always happy to answer any questions. We were room only,you could have a continental breakfast for 17 euros but we just decided to get breakfast ourselves. The hotel is very central,there is a metro five minutes from the hotel,we used it quite alot it is very cheap roughly 3 euros for the two of us to get anywhere is Paris. It is about a 10min walk to the Champs Elysees from the hotel! This is where all the shops and restraunts are,it is very busy but really nice to walk down. We bought a two day open top bus tour which was well worth the money - it was hop on hop off,there were four diff routes and you can just jump on and off as you please. I would have no doubts about staying at this hotel again - it was beautiful! Looking to book again it was so nice! Paris is a gorgeous city - had a ball!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stay all around!”
Reviews.Author: Suzee_Van
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing 3 nights in Hotel Duret in May and have to recommend! Staff very friendly and helpful. Decor and ambience of hotel really lovely. We had a lovely room with a great view out onto streets. 2 minutes from Arc d Triompe and the metro so great location wise. Cost is very competitive compared to similar places ive stayed in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TooksWaterlooville
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Duret from 16 to 19 August 2011 travelling from London St. Pancras on the Eurostar and loved our first visit to Paris. We travelled to the location of our hotel via metro which was easy enough to use once we had got help from the ticketing staff. Hotel: We found the hotel staff to be most helpful and informative and happily answered any questions we asked. They provided us with tea and coffee making facilities on request. Our hotel room was on the second floor which looked out onto the quiet side street. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room as we were aware French hotel rooms are known to be small. The bed was comfortable and the room clean and airy and made up each day. We had no trouble sleeping. The modern bathroom had a decent shower and it was lovely being provided with bathrobes for the duration of our stay. Location: The location was ideal - just a five minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe and 10 - 15 minutes from the Champs-Elysees from where we caught the city tour bus (we booked a 2 day pass from home but it is easy enough to pay once you have arrived in Paris at roughly the same cost). Food: We ususally purchased our brunch from the nearby excellent Pastisserie opposite the main road and ate out in restaurants in the evening. Be prepared though - eating and drinking (including soft drinks and teas and coffee) out in Paris does not come cheap! sightseeing: The 2 day open top bus tours are well worth doing as is the River Seine cruise. There are plenty of sights to see. Be prepared to queue for the Eiffel Tower. Waited in line for approx 1 1/2 hours but it was worth it! If you want to go right to the top you will need to purchase an extra ticket once inside on one of the platforms. The Louvre is massive! As stated previously by other trip advisors, it is very busy inside and can't always get close to the exhibits. The Arc de Triomphe is also worth entering for the view but be prepared for lots of stairs. (I didn't see a lift). Great first trip, looking forward to the second......

Reviews.Title: “Superb - wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Huddleston
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderful 4 days in Paris, staying in Duret - beautiful boutique hotel, well staffed, lovely rooms and a perfect base to stay at. Has a lovely Thai resturant next door and with a short work you are at the Arc de Triomphe. For breakfast we went to the super little boulangarie at end of the street and did not use the hotel, great spot to enjoy Paris, do not miss out on going out to Versailles - worth the short train journey.

Reviews.Title: “In and out, no hassle! Strictly boutique”
Reviews.Author: Eurotripping9
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Duret is lovely - modern in that 90s minimalist way, cute in that Parisian hotel way. Cute also translates into tiny rooms. The norm in Paris, certainly, but had I been sharing my room with someone else on a long term basis I'm not sure I would have coped. For the solo traveller however, it's perfect. Close to the Air France car at Porte Maillot (3 mins walk) and so handy for both La Defense for business or the centre of Paris for sightseeing. Breakfast was fantastic - a tiny room with a super duper continental buffet! One small complaint about the wifi - I left my luggage on the lat day and when I returned in the evening the staff would not allow me to use the wifi. It works on a voucher system - valid for the period you have checked in for. But come on Hotel Duret, this hotel could be an excellent little business gem if you ironed out such glitches. Perfect for a weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ruby258
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Hotel Duret and it was just as pleasant as our first stay back in 2007. The service was excellent and our room was clean. The hotel is located on a quiet street with easy access to a nearby bakery, pharmacy, general store and subway. We took the Air France bus from de Gaulle which dropped us off by the Arc de Triomphe, then a short 5-10 min walk to the hotel. We had breakfast included with our room rate and it was enough to get us started each day. We will definitely stay here again on our return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foxycreature
Reviews.Content: Essentialy a hotel for the business person, no pretentious gym or jacuzzi facilities it was just right for us, away for a few days birtrhday celebration. Had a deluxe room which looked recently refurbished, very clean, everything worked. Our room overlooked the main street, but was quiet. Hotel is nicely situated for the Arc de Triomphe, and the Eifel Tower. Didn't have the breakfasts which seemed a bit overpriced and the dining room full of guests on their computers, but got more of a local feel by purchasing the freshly made baguettes and pastries from the shop at the end of the road and eating in the local gardens and parks. There is a Thai restaurant nearby, gets very crowded and has small tables crammed in, but the food was good. Had a dinner cruise on the Seine, very nice and romantic, try for the price option with a window seat, same menu with slight variations but a better experience. Do beware as you leave the boat and go up the steps by the bridge and the Eifel Tower, pick pockets operate here and target passengers coming off the boats after a night out. It was good to return to our comfortable bed at the Hotel Duret. There is a fridge and a safety deposit box provided and a supermarket just yards away so a bottle of ice cold champagne awaits your return after a night out. Altogether a nice holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good”
Reviews.Author: jokumali
Reviews.Content: Little investment in customer care. The receptionist when I arrived was unable to help with anything other than giving me the key card, and explained that he was filling in for a friend. Breakfast is somewhat basic. Location is very good, however. Also, there was some litter in the lift (sweet wrappers on the floor, etc...). I was surprised that this had not been cleaned up 24 hours later. Last gripw was that the room I stayed in had a toilet in a separate part of the room from the bathtub. The internet access is free, which is a plus, but wired broadband as opposed to wireless. The receptionist was unable to make it work so i had to wait until the next morning to get someone to sort it out.

Reviews.Title: “The quality of your stay is in the hands of the other residents......”
Reviews.Author: AlisonSergeant
Reviews.Content: This smart hotel in the 16th is unusual for its lovely sized rooms and well thought out decor. The staff were wonderful, the room clean and well kitted out. Towels lovely and fluffy, bathroom really very nice, shower excellent. Duret has Free WiFi which is really helpful for visitors with smartphones etc. BUT, and this is a BIG BUT, I chose this hotel because the web site promised our deluxe room would be sound proofed. Which it was not. Not at all. Not even slightly. The too large gap under our door meant we heard every shuffle, mutter and knock from the corridor. The cardboard between us and the bathroom next door meant we heard much worse than that. And whilst we didn't get much sleep, we know other people didnt either due to the ..um... amorous... noises coming from another room (possibly with a large gap under their door too...). Add to that a strange double tapping noise coming from somewhere below us every half an hour or so ( at one point my husband even called out 'come in'!) Luckily the room next to us was empty the next night and so we did get some sleep eventually. It is a funny thing - if they had not promised us a sound proof room, we probably would not have minded as much - we have stayed in Paris many times before and know that peace and quiet is not the reason for your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ozzypud
Reviews.Content: Picked this Hotel on the strength of the good reviews.Travelled to Paris on the Eurostar. From Gare Du Nord Station short walk to the Metro and platform 42 on the blue line. Change at Chatelet onto yellow line to Argentine station. Hotel only a few minutes walk away cost 1 euro 70 each on the Metro. Staff very friendly and polite at reception and quick book in as prepaid. Stayed in a standard room which was clean, very comfortable with modern decor .Although the room had air-con still found it warm at night and had to have the window open so did have some early morning street noise with refuge collectors. The fridge came in handy and it was good to have a roomsafe. Did not eat at the hotel therefore cannot comment on the food. From the hotel the Arc de Triomphe was about 5 minutes walk away with the Eiffel Tower about 30 minutes walk away. Supermarket just across the road which was ideal ,along with a bakers ideal for filled baguettes. As a base for our stay in Paris it was an excellent hotel as we were able to get to the main attractions by a combination of leg power and the Metro and you felt safe at night. You do not have to check out until noon and we were allowed to leave our bags in reception which was good. Would recommend this hotel and very satisfied that we chose it for our stay. A scam to be wary of whilst out walking is either a male or female throwing a wedding ring on the floor near to you and then claiming that they have just found it and want you to have it as it is your lucky day and it will not fit them, then they start asking you for money for food.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: texas_poptart
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Paris with my boyfriend and stayed at Hotel Duret for two nights. Such a wonderful location....right off the Champs Elysees and in walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and right down the street from the Arc De Triomphe. The hotel itself was very clean, quiet, cozy. The room was adorable, loved the bathroom....it had a large window that you could open up. The room also had an adorable balcony that you could go out onto with a nice view of the street. The lobby and interior of the hotel was also very charming. The staff was nice and accommodating as well. I would definitely stay there again when back in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in the 17th”
Reviews.Author: YinxFed
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Duret. We found the staff to be delightful and the boutique hotel to be clean, modern and well designed. The hotel is pretty well situated for most of the best sights in Paris - some of which were in walking distance. And having an iconic monument like the Arc de Triomphe just around the corner was surreal! We can also recommend the Thai restaurant which is next door - we had a scrummy lunch there. Do go and stay at the Duret, you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: CAEWALES
Reviews.Content: Like all the other reviewers, would say this hotel is in a great location, just away from the very busy Arc de Tri and Champs Elysee, on a relatively quiet road. The room was a lovely corner one. It was generally spacious and had a lovely large ensuite bathroom . The hotel was generally clean, however, the picture rails (thick with dust!) and the carpets (especially the stair ones leading up from the ground floor) would benefit from a spring clean! The staff were pleasant and helpful and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. We did not eat in the hotel, but went out for breakfast and the cafe culture. Wish we had such good croissants and pain au chocolat here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location for Paris first timers”
Reviews.Author: skip007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with my wife on our first trip to paris. Found the service to be amazing and location wonderful. Excellent english spoke in the hotel. Very clean and modern. Given the location this hotel is good value for money. Easy access to all the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, beautiful decor for a great price”
Reviews.Author: AnnaClaire116
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel! It was by far the nicest we stayed in during our 10-day trip to France. I loved that the decor was sleek, modern and updated - very chic. And our room was SPOTLESS. I'm kind of a clean freak about hotel rooms and had absolutely no complaints about this one. The concierge at the front desk was super nice, spoke flawless English and recommended a lovely little restaurant within walking distance. The other bonus was that this hotel room was not as expensive as I would have thought, based on the accommodations. Within walking distance of a number of sights, and close to the subway. I wish we had stayed at the Duret during the earlier part of our stay, but at least now I know where to go on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Small modern hotel with good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EarthDiscover
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days there. First impression is small but newly deco hotel. Lobby is small but has TV, internet room, tea and eating area. Elevator is very small for 4 to 6 people but adequate for both of us with luggage going to our floor. Room is small but cozy with French balcony. We did take some photos there. Although it turns into a small street, surprisely found HSBC, a supermarket, a very good and reasonably priced Chinese restaurant (contrary to what I've heard that Chinese food in Paris is aweful and pricy), Japanese and Thai restaurants, pharmacy, bakery shop all in one short street. For those motorcyclists there are lots of car and motorcycle dealers and accessories shops along the path to Champs Elysees 10 minutes away. I bought 1 jacket just for fun. We have breakfast included in the hotel though varieties are quite the same everyday but it worths. The concierge is helpful and coffee is good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Purrggrr69
Reviews.Content: Great location fab rooms, excellent service and close to everything u want to see and do in Paris....a real find!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous small but chic spot”
Reviews.Author: TaraLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here during a short city break; the room was lovely. The bathroom was lovely - very nice size and with a view onto a small private courtyard. The reception staff were helpful and made some decent suggestions for dinner (nothing amazing but nice). Hotel has great transport links and is just a lovely spot. The only downside were our neighbours who made a lot of noise coming home in the evenings and because the rooms are small the doors into them are right beside each other so we could hear the neighbours coming and going - not really the hotel's fault though! The lift in this hotel is a tiny little glass thing - barely fits 2 people without luggage! Very large people (overweight) would just not fit. There are great Eurostar train/hotel deals for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manchester_Dabs
Reviews.Content: Firstly the hotel is lovely, not where you would expect, on a modest street 5 minutes from the Arc De Triumph. Nearby there are super markets, wine shops, bank, restaurants etc. It is a really well presented hotel and the staff were superb - though we tried to speak pigeon French, they were always very patient and helpful! The rooms are typically Parisian in that they are pretty small but more than adequate for a long weekend. They are all modern with sympathetic decorating and dressing, all with clean, modern en suites. Ours had LCD TV, Mini Bar, Safe & Hairdryer but I was surprised not to find Tea/Coffee facilities - the breakfast is €16 PP which is really too high for the usual buffet style. However there is a great local bakery a stones throw away where you can get incredible pastries - would have been nice to have been able to make a coffee in our room to enjoy them with. There is also no WiFi in the hotel which was another surprise these days, however there is free net access in the lounge room off the main lobby. With regards positioning it is a 5 min walk to the Arc De, another 10-15mins down the Champs, then another 15mins or so to the Louvre, generally speaking it is a bit too far to enjoy a casual walking weekend but there are well placed metro stations within 2mins walk of the hotel. All in all a smashing little hotel for a weekend break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit and still as lovely”
Reviews.Author: TDH864
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel. Nicely tucked away from the main streets, but only 5 mins walk to the Arc de Triumph. The staff are very friendly and really helpful. Rooms are spotless and apart from one night where other guests woke me, lovely and quiet. It's nice to get away from all the noise and people after a day around Paris. We will be going back (if too many people don;t find out about this place and we can still get a room!). We didn't pay for breakfast, we preferred to go out. A lovely bakers on the corner and a cafe bar next to it were both fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a long weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JennyandGraham
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Hotel Duret and it surpassed our expectations. The lobby to this boutique hotel is trendy and funky with striped carpets and chandeliers. I thought the rooms couldn't live up to this, but our room was perfect (small) with everything needed including fridge and secrity deposit box. The room was spotless, bed comfy with high quality sheets, contemporary and very quiet. Staff were incredibly helpful and there were free newspapers and internet. The hotel is just by Argentine underground station and just five minutes from Arch de Triomphe. An excellent location. There are lots of businesses around and makes it is slightly out of touriste-ville with better quality and priced restaurants. I highly recommend this hotel but now worry that if too many people go, I won't be able to get back in!

Reviews.Title: “Not overly impressed...”
Reviews.Author: liswal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel recently with my husband and another couple. I don't think we were overly impressed with the service at the hotel and the location was ok. Breakfast was not included 16 euro breakfast, seemed over priced for what was included. Staff seemed a bit spacey. Overall the hotel was clean, but I prefer a location closer the Latin Quarter - more cozy less busy streets.

Reviews.Title: “Little bit tired, but cracking place overall”
Reviews.Author: Dave-Sally
Reviews.Content: We (wife, me + 3 other couples) stayed here for the Heineken Cup 2010. The location is absolutely 100% - 5 minute walk from the Arc and 10 - 15 mins from Eiffel Tower. The staff are all mega friendly (manager was a bit grumpy as had to call him out when the lock on our room seized with us on the outside and rugby tickets on the inside) - but the reception staff could not door more to help. Spoke perfect English and would even speak very slowly to you in French if you are looking to improve the lingo. Rooms are comfy - we had the basic double which was not small but not large. Bed was cosy (when in Paris........ah hem) and comfortable. Room was clean and fresh towels. No tea or coffee making facilities in the room though. The location was also very quiet for such a central one - a quiet side street. Didn't eat there as the breakfast was too expensive for what you get - so went to the Boulongerie(?) just down the room for a breakie picnic. There are lots of cafe/bars/brasseries very close bye - we spent £600 one night on a meal for six at the brasserie (great steaks) one night and then £150 in the chinese (almost) next door the night. The Chinese was great. Didn't get around to trying the Thia though. Very easy to get the Metro - just hold up the Parisiennes at the ticket machine and someone will help you out. To summarise, the hotel could do with a little freshening up.....very minor.....but great place and staff really made the trip worthwhile. We would stay again as great value for money. For style we would stay at the Hotel Garden Elysee, but at the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: Tue1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic boutique hotel in a lovely quite area, with fantastic service. I've stayed here a couple of times, on my own and with my Girlfriend and love everything about it. It's easy for tube access, it's on a very cute little Parisian street and will certainly start you off on a high if it's your first time in Paris. It's small but it's had some specials guests that have stayed there, I noticed in the guest book, which the staff are very discreet about and it also has rooms which can be hired downstairs for small events.***** Fully recommend it if your on your own, there for work or with a loved one ******* One of my fave hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Prospect_Park_Johnny
Reviews.Content: Excellent little boutique property. As someone who tends to like places like Park Hyatt, I was quite pleased with the design, decor, service, location and bar/food. Would go back to this nice little place anytime. John

Reviews.Title: “Surprising Finding ! Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Palalagaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights during the Valentine weekend and it was our first time in Paris. I did not expect much but was very much surprised about the location, service and the size of the room. It was not large but it was more than enough since we were out most of the time. Free broadband, quiet but convenient location, so close to Argentine or Porte Maillot subway. Nice restuarant and the bakery around the corner makes the experience truly parisian if you dig for authentic croissant, pain au chocolat, pain de amande ,baguette etc. Also theres a grocery store, butcher, deli , japanese sushi bar, chinese, thai and local fishmonger where you can buy freshly shucked oysters . Staff are very helpful and speaks English well, you will feel like a long lost friend from the time you check in and check out.

Reviews.Title: “excellent,clean,great location...”
Reviews.Author: looboo500
Reviews.Content: nothing more to say, small but stylish rooms,great thai restaurant next door and mini supermarket. lovely bakery 2mins away for coffee's and breakfast and 2mins walk to the Argentine metro.... would stay here again.....

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location was central but nicley tucked away.”
Reviews.Author: Davidmyers27
Reviews.Content: There is nothing bad to say about this hotel, the staff were very polite and helpfull and the rooms clean and extremly well presented.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: alexny72
Reviews.Content: Loved the Duret. Great location, friendly staff, stylish rooms but a bit small (common for Paris). The location was great, restaurants,bakeries, sites within walking distance. Although the main attractions like the Louvre and the eiffel tower are a bit far ,the underground metro is close by so you can be anywhere in the city within a short while. We chose the Duret hotel because of the great rates compared to what we saw in their website and also based on previous reviews and we where more than pleased. We had already spent a few days at a small resort next to Disneyland just a bit off Paris and decided to move to inside the city area and spend some time there and i must say its a whole different feeling the city is a like a fairy tale. a little tip: if you go to the Arch of triumph and buy a ticket avoid the steps next to the ticket office, i think there where 300 steep steps to the top floor. just exit the arch again and look for the elevator. Unfortunately we realized it existed on the way down. If you have trouble with steps these ones are killers!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: SteRos
Reviews.Content: A OK hotel ideally located between the Place de l'Etoile and Porte Maillot, just steps from the Champs Elysée. Very small but "cosy" rooms vith a very small doublebed - facing a busy street with a lot of traffic. The hotels is close to many restaurants and pubs, but due to the area/location prices for food and drinks are relatively high. Next time in Parise we will choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, polite staff but facilities need upgrading”
Reviews.Author: Joe2316
Reviews.Content: The good: -The Hotel Staff are very very good. Polite, helpful and prompt. They are the best asset this hotel has. -Location. Although not exactly central, just 2 minutes from Argentine or 5 minutes from Port Maillot and 5 minutes from the Arc D'Triomphe. -Location again. Upmarket road. Nice Shops. Really nice deli & baker within 30 seconds walk! The not so good. -Rip-off breakfast. At 16 Euro, this is a joke, unless your company is picking up the tab. -Rooms tired. Room 305 was in dire need of a makeover. Moved to room 605 and this was better, but the air-con was useless in both rooms so they may have a problem hotel-wide. -Dodgy electrics. Both rooms had light not working and some mains points out of action, unless you switched on the lamps!?!? -Noise. You can really hear the neighbours next door and upstairs, which is why we moved to floor 6. -Bathrooms a bit mucky. Both bathrooms had a fair bit of mould and cheap fittings. -No wifi. Minor point? Maybe. Free wired LAN only is good, but not good for iPhones or similar. But there is a PC in the lobby, which is free. -No tea/coffee in room. This is a pain as a coffee or tea is 4 Euro at the local cafe. We brits like a cuppa in the room please :-) OK this may sound like a moan, but I'm being honest here, given the price of the rooms. GIven all that, I would consider the hotel again if the points were addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Fab, cool, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunnybears
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week on our honeymoon. It was about 100 degress the July that we visited Paris but the air con in the hotel is fab. The rooms are small as with all Parisian hotels but it was modernly decorated, had a lovely and clean bathroom and good TV services should you feel the need to stay in ?!? Wonderful location, just steps away from the metro and 2 minute walk to the Arc De Triomphe and Champs Elysse. Expensive though so look for a deal online.

Reviews.Title: “Small clean room with friendly staff, Good location”
Reviews.Author: PikaLondon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Hotel Duret for a weekend (2 nights). We booked a standard double room which was located on the first floor. The hotel is advertised as "botique" but I think the only thing really fitting this description is the fact it has stripy wall paper and carpet and is very small. That being said the place was clean, the room was clean, the bathroom was bigger than I expected with a bath and mouted shower over the bath. There wasn't a great deal of pressure from the small showerhead but it was fine for two nights. You get slippers and bath robes and standard toiletries. Air con worked well which is important in summer. The street is quiet so there is no disturbance from the outside. The walls must be quite thin as I often heard people coughing, talking and banging around in their rooms. If you want to be near the night life then this hotel is not for you as you would have to take a cab or the Metro to get close to the river where there seemed to be plenty happening in the evening. A taxi to the river (near Notre dame) was 11 Euros. The pillows were odd, one seemed to be filled with those small pollestyrene balls you get as package filling but as there were two pillows each I used the other one which was fine. The bed was a bit hard though and I did leave with a slightly sore lower back. There is a small fridge in the wardrobe which was surprisingly big - was a walk in style wardrobe - which I didn't expect from the size of the room. Some of that space would be well used for room around the bed. We checked out Sunday afternoon (12 noon check out time) and our train wasn't until 19:15 but the guy at the front desk let us leave our luggage for the day. We even came back after sight-seeing and went to the hotel toilets so we could freshen up after a day walking around in the punishing summer sun. The hotel toilets were clean and has face cloths for drying your hands which you can use to wash / dry your face if you are in the same position as we were. The guy at the desk was always very friendly and helpful. It did seem expensive though (300 Euros for two nights) given the size of the room. The room is fine for a weekend but any longer and we would have needed more space. Bring a print out with you of the name of the street as none of the taxi drivers we used recognised the hotel name or the street name (rue Duret). The hotel is located on a quiet street. The Arc de Triomphe is visible from the main road just up from the hotel and is within walking distance (around 15 mins). The hotel is 2 mins walk from Metro line No. 1 which is the line for Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Arc de Triompe, Champes Elysee. This is the easiest way to see the sights. Pay 11.60 Euros for 10 tickets as cabs can be expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spacious suite in quiet neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: we4like2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in a suite which was 2 spacious rooms for the 4 of us (2 adults and 2 children). It is on the expensive side but it was for 1 night and we wanted an air-conditioned hotel in a quiet, safe neighborhood and within walking distance to the Air France shuttle bus stop (about 10 min walk). The decor is modern and comfortable. The bathroom was nice and big. However, the only complaint is the shower - the water pressure was fine but there is no shower curtain or door - only a small, swinging glass panel which did little to stop any water from spraying outside of the huge tub! Aside from that, everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Duret!”
Reviews.Author: skippy82
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Duret located near the Arc de Triomphe. We thought the hotel was fantastic. We were able to walk to all the major attractions and also took advantage of the close location to the metro (Argentine). We took the Air France shuttle from the airport to Porte Malliot which was an easy 10 minute walk from the hotel ($14euro each). We found the hotel staff to be very friendly and happy to provide advice on all things Paris. The room was very modern and tastefully decorated with a nice bathroom. We stayed in room 501 which was a standard superior room - it wasn't large but had a cute terrace overlooking the street. The hotel was very quiet during the night which we were very pleased about. However, for those that are looking for more night life, we'd suggest staying on the other side of the city - maybe around St Germain or the Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “superb service,location and style”
Reviews.Author: brentaz
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading reviews on this web site , the directions to find the place is easy. We arrived to a very polite welcome from Edward and all rooms we booked for our party was perfect,spotless and stylish. We got an upgrade to the better room with a view of the cool parisian streets outside.This is a super hotel to visit paris with a location and the service. The main party night i had bought some nice champagne and asked for some glasses to our roof for a little pre dinner drink for 10 people, edward again was most helpful suggesting that we could use the bar, that night he sent up icebuckets,glasses and olives and nuts. Thats service going the extra mile.I will not be using any other hotels for any future paris trips.Duret ticks all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced!!!”
Reviews.Author: SaoirseD10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days and reserved a "deluxe" room priced at €250 a night. The room was basic and wasn't at all what I expected for the price. The first night when we retired I could hear the people next door talking clearly and their toilet flushing! I rang reception and the receptionist said he would ring the next room to complain. I told him they were not being overly noisy and it was the problem of sound proofing in the hotel, he told me to complain to the manager and there was nothing more they could do. On our last night we came back to the hotel at midnight and asked for a drink in the bar. The receptionnist said it was too late! Not what you would expect from a luxury hotel!! There was no restaurant only a small dining area for breakfast and no spa. On the plus side the hotel was located right beside the arc de triomphe and the breakfast was good. I wouldn't stay there again, overpriced for what it was!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Smart & Clean rooms / bathrooms, Top service”
Reviews.Author: horses_and_dogs
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Paris for the weekend - it was our first trip to the city. We booked this hotel using the Eurostar package and have no regrets. It is very conveniently located, in a quiet lane, a stone's throw from Champs Elysees / Arc de Triomphe. The 2 guys at reception were very warm. friendly and helpful. The room was smart, modern, clean and so was the bathroom - very important. The only thing lacking in the room was a kettle - which has become the standard in most hotels - and it costs 5 Euros for a cup of tea there! The room was comfortable and had a small balcony as well. If we stayed in the same area, i would have no problems returning to this hotel again. There is a great boulangerie around the corner and a small supermarket half a block down the same lane in case one needs to buy things. The hotel has a small dining room but we didnt use it because we were hardly there and breakfast is a bit pricey at 16 Euros each. It also has a nice parlour plus bar with international newspapers - plus a laptop with high speed internet connection in a lounge. Though we did not carry a laptop with us for the weekend, but apparently they told us that the wifi connection was not working.

Reviews.Title: “Price too high for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Miez
Reviews.Content: My sister and I chose the Hotel Duret after reading all the great comments on tripadvisor. We then researched the hotel and everything looked great. However, when we arrived our hotel room was very dirty and some things were even broken. Upon complaining to the receptionist we got a snooty answer and were told that she will send someone to fix it. When we got back to the hotel in th evening the receptionist again had an attitude and the room was still not very clean. The only positive thing about the hotel was its nice location but in all honesty, I think there are better hotels in Paris...

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy”
Reviews.Author: h0telguest
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in one of the suites. Looks very nice, plenty of room and a spacious bathroom. Stayed with my two kids, for which the sofa-chairs were changed into beds. Breakfast in the hotel is good. €16,- is not cheap, but because children have breakfast for free, acceptable. Good assortiment in sorts of small breads/croissants. The staff is very friendly and they speak very good English. Are willing to help with any guidance they can. Location is very good, near metro 'Argentine', close to the Arc de T. Next visit to Paris, I will definitely reconsider staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigbird29
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the Hotel Duret and found it a very pleasant, cosy and modern hotel. The hotel is well located on a quiet street near the Arc De Triomphe. We did not have breakfast in the hotel but there were plenty of places nearby to eat. The lady on reception was generally quiet pleasant but we did not find her particularly helpful in booking restaurants for us. The hotel was very quiet at night and the air conditioning was very good. I would certainly recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: lizzie70
Reviews.Content: Myself and my other half have just come back from our 2 night stay in Paris at this lovely Hotel. All the staff were extrmely helpful and very friendly. The Hotel is close to the Metro which is great to travel around all the other Tourist Sites. We were situated close to the Arc De Triomphe, which was just around the corner and the Champs Elysees which is great for shopping! The room we had was lovely, it was very clean and cosy. The bathroom was lovely and again very clean. There were even bathrobes, which was a lovely touch. I would definately recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: franman
Reviews.Content: We spent five wonderful nights at the Hotel Duret for the Paris portion of our honeymoon. Because of the great reviews on this site, I chose this hotel and we were not disappointed. We stayed in one of the suites and it was perfect for us. It felt like we were going home to our own apartment in Paris after spending the whole day sightseeing. Paris is one of the most beautiful cities in the world. The hotel is located in more of a residential area about a ten minute walk from the Arc d Triomphe. I loved this neighborhood which had a great mix of local shops including a supermarket, wine shop, pharmacy, boulangerie, and several restaurants. The hotel is about a five minute walk to the Argentine metro stop which takes you directly to many of the major sites of Paris. The metro system in Paris is fabulous. The front desk was very helpful in booking dinner reservations and tours. I would definitely stay at the Hotel Duret again and highly recommend it to anyone looking to get a more intimate Parisian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLG78
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in the Duret - it is a great location for the Arc d'triomphe, eiffel tower and champs-elysees and there are some nice bars and restaurants in easy walking distance. We got a free upgrade from a standard to a superior room and were able to check in when we arrived in Paris at 11.30am - which was really welcome after the flight and metro in from Charles de Gaulle. The staff are all very helpful, rooms immaculately clean and tidy and very comfortable (big rooms for Paris) - we didn't have the breakfast at the hotel as there was an amazing patisserie at the end of the road which sold wonderful croissants and pain au chocolat, as well as fresh baked bread and freshly brewed coffees. Would recommend this hotel for a peaceful spot but if you want to be close to the louvre or montmatre areas it is a bit of a hike - or a ride on the metro - but then given the size of Paris nothing is that close! Good value for money - book direct with the hotel, it was at least 25 euro a night cheaper than anywhere else i found the hotel advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Travel789
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 5-night stay at the Duret. Rooms were quite large for a Paris hotel. Decor was very modern. Staff were nice and helpful. Free PC use with internet access at the lobby. It's a 5 min walk to the Argentine metro stop. There's a grocery store 2 doors away from the hotel and an excellent bakery at the corner. We picked up croissants there every morning. There's also a fruit stand, and several other shops just steps away from the hotel. We'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: GerMcManus
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very modern, small, but great rooms with lovely bathroom. Staff were beyond excellent. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Comfortable, and Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: BrookMeakins
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Duret! Our bags were delayed for five days, and the Hotel Duret was our first stop. The staff could not have been more helpful- made all the phone calls to the airline for us, gave us advice on which articles of clothing the airline would pay us for, and advised us on where to go shopping... People greet you with a "bonjour" and a smile. The room was really nice- sometimes the more "modern" hotels I choose feel a little too sterile, and this was not the case at the Hotel Duret. The dark slate in the bathrooms, the soft robes, the gorgeous windows and balcony, the silky sheets- the hotel felt stylish, but very warm. Of course, the location is great too. This was a great choice for our first few nights in Paris- I think you will love it. I would be happy to answer questions if you have any!

Reviews.Title: “This a lovely modern hotel in a good location with nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: LisaRob
Reviews.Content: Hotel Duret is a small, stylish, boutique hotel. When you walk in through the auto glass doors you are presented with a pleasant reception and lounge/bar area. The room that we had (101) was ok in size, nice bathroom and very clean. Location of the Hotel is good, less than a 5 minute walk to Argentine metro station, which is on the main line to all the attractions ( Louvre etc..) There is great Patisserie at the end of the road where you can grab breakfast, lunch or a snack from. We ate at the Thai restaurant across the road from the hotel for lunch, and it was very nice. The best restaurant we ate at was called "Le Petit Pergolèse" (the hotel can give you directions) this was a few roads from the hotel. This was a small intimate, vibrant, cosy restaurant, which served modern French food. We had a wonderful time and highly recommend that you go for dinner. Overall would definitely recommend this hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and well located”
Reviews.Author: jnha
Reviews.Content: A small hotel with elegant and cosy rooms. The bathrooms are well equipped and feature a nice set of amenities. I liked the place where the breakfast is served although there could be a larger choice at the buffet. The hotel is conveniently loctade near in a small street the Place de l'Etoile. The only con is the parking difficulty in the area if you drive your car.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dowcomp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Duret Hotel 4 nights in the beginning of February. We arrived early in the morning but our room ready. They gave us 101 on the first floor. Then we enter the room there was a terrible smell of some kind of air refresher. We kept the window open about 20 minutes, when I was frosted and smell didn't disappear I called receptionist, she said that hotel is fully booked and advised us to open the window... it was +3 degrees outside. This smell was in the room two days, but after, it was ok. And this trouble couldn't spoil our stay. The room was clean with big closet and big bathroom. The safe in the closet and bathrobes in the bathroom were really appreciated. The personnel of Duret Hotel was very helpful and kind especially night receptionists (as we spoke mostly with them). They always gave us advice how to get to some place, and were offering tours and tickets to Paris attractions. Location is very good, central and quiet. Metro station is only 2 minutes by walk. Many restaurants, 2 bakeries, supermarket and greengrocery store, were we were buying strawberry and cherry, are nearby. In general we enjoyed our stay very much. We would like to say thank you to the hotel staff for our stay. And we can definitely recommend Hotel Duret to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Still holding strong!”
Reviews.Author: bukish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a second time after 2 years. Still wonderful boutique hotel with welcoming and efficient staff, clean and stylish rooms. Although we havent got just as good room as last time, it is still quite nice, especially by parisian standards. Applauds to the designer, again. What is new as compared to last visit - a restaurant opened just across a little street, called Madame Shawn. Wonderful, loungy, yummy (yet adopted to european taste unless you ask for special "spicieness"!) thai restaurant. Highly recommend, especially for those willing to try something extra to escargots or just lazy or tired enough to go too far out. Still high five to Hotel Duret, two years have passed, but it still remains "our" address in paris. Thanks to staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: Leasha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Duret in May of this year based on recent reviews & we were not disappointed. This boutique hotel is located on a small street just off Champs Elysee. Around the area are some gorgeous deli's & restaurants that many locals visit. We would quite often pick up some bread & cold meats for lunch & dinner. Our deluxe room was a decent size, compared to Paris standards. Big enough considering we hardly spent any time there. Lovely modern bathroom with shower over bath. Views were of the gorgeous small side streets. Staff were very friendly. Loved the free internet access in the lobby available to all guests. Will visit again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: Voochie
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on this website and I have to say that it surpassed my high expectations. The rooms are great, it is very stylishly decorated and as mentioned by several other reviews the lady at the front desk is really wonderful. I would highly recommend this hotel and am already planning my return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: haithgirl
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Duret is fantastic. The staff is just about the best I have ever come across. The location is convenient to everything, including a fabulous little bakery within steps of the hotel. The rooms are the highlight. Larger than any room I experienced in all of Europe. (Excluding any suites.) The bed is super comfy and the bathroom is so large. Even getting there from CDG is easy by the Air France bus and a short walk. During our stay, the Metro station closest to the hotel was closed, but it was no bother. The stroll to the next closest one had us walking up towards the Arc de Triomphe every morning. Who complains about something like that? Life should be so difficult. My parents are going to Paris around the holidays and they are already booked up at the Hotel Duret. It's just simply the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: CCTC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I selected this hotel based on previous reviews written on TripAdvisor.com. Those reviews were overwhelmingly positive, and our experience was the same. The hotel is a small, boutique hotel, re-furbished with American tastes in mind -- larger than normal (for Paris) room sizes, King-size beds, and very large (by Parisian) standard bathrooms. Our room (with a balcony overlooking a quiet Paris street -- Rue Duret) was very quiet and very clean. We booked a breakfast and room package ($300/night, which was a great rate for the quality), with no deposit required -- credit card to gurantee the room. The cancellation terms were acceptable -- within 24 hours of arrival, if I recall correctly. The hotel staff spoke good English by Parisian standards. Most, if not, all of the guests were also English speakers. The location is good, not great -- hotel is one block off the Avenue des Grand Armees (other side of Arc de Triomphe), but fine for us. The hotel more than measured up, and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Indy1972
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on tripadvisor by doing the same thing you are doing now....reading the reviews from others. I am pleased to say that our experience at the Hotel Duret validated our expectations based on the numerous positive reviews here. We stayed in one of the small rooms. We expected it to be small, but we like each other so it was cozy. I have traveled in Europe many times and I am used to the smallish hotel rooms. The small rooms would be just fine for a happy couple. Not so much for a guy trip, etc. The hotel itself was great. It has a trendy feel to it while retaining its character. Everyone we encountered at the front desk was exceptionally friendly and helpful. They gave us a great sushi recommendation just across the Avenue Grand Armee (forget the name). The location was perfect. We were looking for something that had an authentic Parisian feel rather than a tourist trap. I think we found it. The hotel is situated in a residential area with several cafes. It is also right on the metro, which by the way is the best public transportation system I have ever experienced. You can get anywhere in Paris in 20 minutes. However, don't take the metro everywhere -- walk to the Arch, down the Champs, and over to the Eiffel tower. These are all easy and safe walks and the only way to truly experience Paris. We would stay here again and would recommend the Duret to friends and family. Ignore the few negative comments on here and keep and mind that there are some people out there that you just cannot please. We all know a few...

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris hotel, but the location could be better”
Reviews.Author: JayhawkIke
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I stayed in two different hotels in Paris during a recent trip (was broken up by a jaunt over to Venice), and the Hotel Duret was by far the better of the two. The size of our room was great (especially compared to the other hotel in which we stayed) as size seems to be a concern from my review of the posts on here re: Paris hotels. The hotel was very modern - appeared to have been recently remodeled - everything appeared very new. It has a very modern finish, with modern paint, fixtures, finishes, etc. Was nice and quiet, and the staff was helpful in trying to get reservations at restaurants. The only downside to the Duret (in my opinion) was the location. It's close to the Port Maillot station which is helpful in getting there from CDG, but it is on the western edge of Paris' "centre" districts. It's a 3-minute walk to the closest Metro station, though, so even though not on the left bank, still OK. If it was on the Left Bank, this would be a no-brainer place to stay. I would still highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Femmers
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of all the good reviews on this website. Unfortunatly all the standard rooms were fully booked, so we decided to pay an extra 30 euros to get a superior room. The staff was really nice and helpful. The size of the room was okay. The room was clean and we had internet acces (a bit slow, and we had to bring a cable). The bathroom looked really nice and clean. The rooms were noisy. We were able to hear our neighboors talking and the cleaning staff was a bit loud in the moring. Over all, I found the hotel okay. Compared to other big citys in Europe, it was an expensive room. In London you are able to book a room like this for 2/3 of this price. The bakery on the corner of Rue Duret and Av. Grand Armee was really good. Next to the hotel (on the right) was a small supermarke, where you can get drinks and food. On the second day of our stay we had dinner at Pasta del Papa (not Pastapapa, which is a chain of Italian restaurants in Paris), close to the hotel. Dinner was great, staff was nice, price was good. When you are willing to pay 170 euros a night for a room, I would definatly book Hotel Duret. Next time I will go to Paris, I will look for something cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: cb333
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in Aug. I'm impressed by this hotel. location is great. 3 min walk to the metro (Argentine), 10 min walk to arc de triumph. Rooms are somewhat small and carpets are a little worn out, but the beds and bathrooms are great. We stayed in room 402. nice cool A/C, bright room. Staffs were very helpful, FREE internet use in the lobby. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: liebejud
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Duret for 5 days at the end of June. Great stay. The decor of the hotel and the room was hip and elegant. We had a deluxe room on the 6th floor. Although there were only 2 twin beds, we pushed them together and it was perfectly fine. The room and bathroom were nicely appointed and very clean. The views of the street and the courtyard behind the building were charming. The staff, without fail, was lovely, helpful and patient with our feeble attempts to speak French (their English was, of course, perfect so we had no communication problems). It was about a 15-20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and under a 10 minute walk to the Champs d' Elise. The metro was just a few minutes away. Excellent pastry shop right on the corner. While the neighborhood wasn't the most charming in the city, it was still very nice and everything we needed and wanted to see was readily available. Heartily recommend this hotel. We hope to return someday!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amyIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend in February and what a great hotel. Location was excellent and the staff there were fab, so helpful. Great little restaurants near by as well and we were able to walk to a lot of the main tourist spots! Would def stay here again. Decor was really cool and the bathroom was lovely, big and clean. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fandangledan
Reviews.Content: Location: 10min walk past the Arc de Triomphe. 5 mins to the metro. Safe & friendly. Room: We stayed in a double. Regular european sized room. Cleanliness was very good. Bathroom was small but very good. Bed was good, nice and firm. Trendy decor. Service: The staff were helpful, no problems. Value: Not bad pricing for Paris, we'll be staying there again. Suited for a couple's break. Breakfast not normally included, perfect place for to enjoy Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: casa1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Duret for three nights. We stayed in a Deluxe room on the top floor. The room was a bit small, but typical of European hotels. The beds were VERY comfortable and the rooms were clean. We were able to sleep with the window open at night which was nice. The location was good -not great - but it was near (a few blocks) a metro station which could take you anywhere in the city very quickly. Walking from the hotel was more a challenge. Although close to the Champs Elysées, walking around the Arc de Triomphe to get there takes a long time. The area is not a tourist area which in some respects is nice (quiet), but there is not a large selection of restaurants near the hotel. The hotel itself is very nice. It is a smaller hotel (I think 25 rooms) and decorated with a sleak style (similar to a W Hotel). The lobby is nice and comfortable with a very small bar. The breakfast was ample with a selection of delicous pasteries, ceral, yogurt, etc. The hotel did seem to be a bit understaffed. The person at the reception desk was also responsible for the bar area and any guest requests. The staff was nice and very helpful. I booked my reservation via email and they were always very quick to respond and very helpful in answering my questions. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Duret.

Reviews.Title: “Very special little hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: essie45229
Reviews.Content: My niece and I spent four wonderful days in Paris. We had an absolute ball and plan to return next spring. I found the Hotel Duret on the internet and we were absolutely thrilled. The hotel is in the 16th Arrondisement on the rue Duret; it is a block or so from the Arc de Triomphe and within a 2 minute walk to the Metro. Also there are bus stops nearby. We booked a deluxe, twin bedded room and we were delighted. The room was very large with a window overlooking the rooftops of Paris (it was like being in a movie). The bathroom was sleek and modern with slate floors and an enormous bathtub with shower and a huge sink. Very American for those who are afraid of small European bathrooms. There was a heated towel rack where we dried our underwear after rinsing them out!!! Downstairs there is a lovely little bar with small tables and comfy sofas to sit on; the breakfast room is nice (but we only had breakfast there once because 16 euros is a lot for breakfast but it's good if you want it); and there is another small lounge with a laptop computer to access the Internet (free!!). I have only ONE, tiny complaint . . . the elevator is very, very small!! Only two people can squeeze on at a time and only if you aren't too fat!!! But we easily overlooked that. Everything else was wonderful. The people at the front desk were so kind and suffered through our stupid questions with a smile!! They all spoke English well enough so there wasn't a problem. There are restaurants all around: I recommend the bakery at the end of the street; amazing pastries along with good sandwiches and hot dishes. Nobody spoke English but we got by on our limited French. There is a restaurant to the left as you go out the front door of the hotel called Camille. Very nice food and the waiter/owner, whoever he was, was so nice and cheery. We laughed so hard and had a great time. There are numerous restaurants up and down all the streets and they are all good. It was so much fun eating at the sidewalk cafes. All in all, the Hotel Duret was simply wonderful and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fish4fun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week in May. It was wonderful. Our room, which was a deluxe was gorgeous. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was large and beautiful. The service in this hotel is what makes it stand out though. Our luggage was lost for the four days and everyone that worked the front desk went out of their way to help us locate it - even getting information when they went home! They were amazing and continued to help us through out the week with everything from plans to little things like converters. Breakfast was perfect - a continental breakfast with plenty of choices. The location was great too - just a few minutes from the Metro station and easy to walk to sights as well. Staying at this hotel really made our trip to Paris perfect. I would stay here again anytime I was in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “FAB HOTEL AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: aznotik
Reviews.Content: Hotel Duret is perfectly located on the yellow metro line that runs length of the city... the nearest stop being 5 min walk away. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and the hotel itself is very clean and modern. Our room was 602 on the top floor (a standard room), it was very small with the sloping attic roof as well. It was a lovely room but if you have the extra cash an upgrade is worth the money as i could tell because of a sneeky peek i had whilst the cleaner was in one of the other rooms. We flew with air france and got their shuttle bus from the airport to port malliott a ten min walk from our hotel, i would really recommend this option of travel. On our first night we wanted something quick and easy so we went to Planet Hollywood- what a huge mistake. It is very tired! Awful food, the food was almost cold. Just totally regret going their and would suggest u find alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for paris”
Reviews.Author: tmandgs
Reviews.Content: Visited duret last spring for 3 nights. was the perfect base for exploring paris. We had a room on the top floor, spacious and comfortable and worth the extra few bucks. (relative to most spots the rates were very affordable) . the local area is residential/commercial so you feel like you are amongst the locals, but then you walk up to Grand Armee, turn right, and see the Arc de Triomphe. Fantastic. The bakery around the corner is amazing, the staff's restaurant recommendations were spot on, the local bistros served up snacks and pitchers of wine that couldn't be beat, and thesubway is a 2 minute walk away. Only down spot was when we ordered martinis sent to the room (tasted terrible) but their coffee was much better. Absolutely no complaints and will do our best to return!

Reviews.Title: “Pricy, but nice boutique style hotel at a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Trollemor
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely four night stay during easter at Hotel Duret, and would love to stay there again. It has a good location, only a five minute walk to the Arch the la Triumph, and three minutes to the nearest matro stop Argentine. We had booked a standard room, but it was pricy, about 220euro a night... However, the room had a nice modern decor, the bed was a queen so on the small side, minibar, tv and a nice tiled bathroom with a bathtub. The downside was that the soundproofing, we could hear the tv from our neighbours and we were waken in the morning by the voices from the hall and nearest rooms. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at Hotel Duret, but we will try to find somewhere less expensive next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkirishangel
Reviews.Content: I booked directly with the Hotel Website and got a good deal for a deluxe room with breakfast. The hotel was a 5 minute walk from the airfrance bus from cdg and a 5 minute walk to the Argentine Metro station. It is in a safe mainly residential area. Staff were very helpful in giving us directions/metro stops etc.. They really made us feel welcome which is sometimes not the case other hotels we have visited. The room, 603, was lovely with a great view of the little Parisian street on which the hotel is located. It was large (deluxe room) but the only problem was the toilet is seperate from the bathroom, which is good in some ways, but there is no window or ventilation in the toilet which can interfere with the romanatic atmosphere!! The breakfast was lovely and the waiter was very attentive in making sure the buffet was fully stocked all the time. There are plenly of bakeries and other little shops around if you want to organise breakfast yourself. All in all, I'd highly recommend this hotel as a good base to explore Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: EmoDublin
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Duret for 4 nights in Feb 07 and we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the decor is funky and modern. The hotel has a very relaxed feel to it and the lounge areas are nicely decorated. We had a standard room which is small but there was plenty of wardrobe space etc so it was fine for us. The bathroon was lovely, again contemporary decor and the shower was fab! The staff in the hotel are very welcoming and very helpful. They recommended some lovely restaurants for us. The location cannot be beaten its less than a 5 min walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees and about a 20 min walk to the Eiffel Tower. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: I have been remiss in my reviewing so forgive folks at the Duret. This was a great find in Paris. Not in a touristy locale, but instead positioned in a VERY upscale, mixed use retail/residential neighborhood. Chic rooms, great views (w/ balconies if you're lucky), basic but classy breakfast, great staff, fantastic bathrooms, and really comfy beds. It's a walk to most of the tourist sights, but the subway is practically right outside, and when you return to your hotel, you get the feeling you are in the real Paris, and about as upscale as metro-Paris can get. I remember reading somewhere a complaint about the Duret was the lack of restaurants in the vicinity... That is COMPLETELY untrue. Over the four days we stayed there in September, we ate at a different place at every meal, that's 12+ meals, and walked to each in less than 10 minutes... and I mean GRRREAT food! That said the one complaint I would voice would be the hotel's restaurant recommendations. The time I tried one, the only people I saw in the restaurant were guests from the Duret... 10 people at 5 tables all Duret guests... feeling like we had been coaxed into a tourist trap, we left and found great Chinese next door to the hotel... I know, Chinese in Paris... yup! Delicious too!!! Make that super delicious. Thereafter, everyday we found excellent fooderies within minutes of every direction we walked. ***The Duret is a very good hotel in an OUTSTANDING location***

Reviews.Title: “We'd highly recommend the Duret”
Reviews.Author: HC10
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Hotel Duret having read the reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. The hotel is in an old building but has been recently refurbished to give a stylish and contemporary decor. The reception staff were extremely friendly and spoke very good English, and were happy to recommend places to eat and the best ways to see the city. We had a standard room and were pleasantly surprised at the size. We had requested a bathroom with a bath, but the bath wasn't full-size - fine if you're not very tall but a bit of a squeeze if you're 6ft! The room was very clean, and the high ceilings and large window helped make it feel light and spacious. The hotel is on a side street so it was nice and quiet too. The only slightly annoying thing was that the air conditioning is set to only heat the rooms in the winter, so you can't cool them down. We found sleeping in the heat difficult, but opening the window solved the problem! The hotel is less than a 5 minute walk from the nearest metro station (Argentine) which is on Line 1 and goes straight through the city centre. It's also no more than a 10 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees and less than 30 mins walk to the Eiffel Tower. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel - they offer either a buffet or room service, instead we went to the bakery at the end of the road which had very good croissants, pastries etc. All in all a very good hotel which we would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: willemchea
Reviews.Content: Thanks to trip advisor, I went with Hotel Duret and was not disappointed. The hotel was in a great location, on the rear side of the Arc. It was about a 10 min. walk to there. Around the corner was the metro station, line 1. There's a convenient market steps away, as well as an ATM and pastry shops. I would definitely stay here again. Great staff, speak English. Rooms were good in size, considering in Europe. Very modern room and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Great Location, Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: messalex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Duret in January 2007. It was our first trip to Paris and friends of us recommended this hotel due to its location. We usually prefer to go to Marriott or Hilton when we travel, so we were a little bit reluctant at first to pick a hotel we did not know. After our stay at the Hotel Duret, we can now say that it was the best decision we could have made. The hotel was great, rooms were very nicely decorated and bathroom was really big. The staff at the hotel was extremely friendly and always helpful. They provides us with a lot of information about places to visit and same for restaurants. Breakfast at the hotel was great, we higly recommend that you try it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Decor and Location Great”
Reviews.Author: Alvin&Tracy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Duret one week before Christmas - We booked this hotel because we prefer contemporary hotels and the location was perfect. We had a suite and the room and the decor of the hotel cannot be faulted (if you like a contemporary style). There is a small bar, however, the receptionist has to serve you - well the truth is although he knew you were there, you eventually had to go and ask him for a drink - a tip, the receptionist does not know how to do a Cappacino and asked if we could pick something else (although it was on the menu !!!). In all, the room, hotel and location are perfect. However, if you want a hotel where there is a fully operational bar and you care more about the service from the staff rather than the room you are staying in, then unfortunately The Duret is not for you. Luckily for us, we care more about the room than the service we received. However, having said this, they arranged a car to pick us up from the airport and that was very efficient and the driver was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: sVT_traveler
Reviews.Content: Loved the location on this hotel. It was in a great neiborhood and 50ft from a metro line that took you to some of the major sights to see. The room was really nice and super clean. The staff is what made it really great. They really went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable and to help us out. The free internet connected computer in the lounge was great to keep in touch with people back home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dalm8n
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Hotel Duret and had a wonderful experience. Understanding that Paris hotels are both ridiculously small and expensive, the Hotel Duret is more than accomodating. The rooms are neat and tidy and the hotel itself has a quite funky vibe to it. As far as location goes you're right outside the subway station so getting to and from is quite easy. I booked our trip after reading reviews on TripAdvisor and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not Great”
Reviews.Author: Paul-SArlington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duret in November 2006 for 5 nights. Overall, an above average hotel. Excellent service at the front desk. However, this is not what I would call a top tier hotel for several reasons. The physical condition of our standard room was rather average with a worn and stained carpet and shower that was prone to flooding the bath floor. We could hear a baby in the next room, even when it was whining, not crying. On our first day in the hotel, after arriving from the airport, the maids knocked on our door probably 4 separate times and tried to open it at least twice while we were sleeping. Finally, there is just one tiny stairway to exit in the case of an emergency (and no sprinkler system). I would recommend staying near the Latin Quarter, where there are many restaurants (French, Greek, Italian, others) with reasonable prices. Or Le Marais, which is a great area with lots of great shops and many restaurants also. There are not many restaurants near the Duret. If you do chose the Duret, I highly recommend taking the Air France shuttle from the airport. The shuttle bus is clean and comfortable and stops about 3 blocks from the hotel. The cost was 20 euros for a roundtrip ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Duret”
Reviews.Author: MaggieUK
Reviews.Content: Spurred on by reviews on this site, we booked this hotel for a romantic pre-Christmas break to Paris. On the whole, we found the hotel "satisfactory". However there were some aspects that I wouldn't expect from a hotel charging £100+/night. There was dust behind the bedside tables, greasy fingerprints on the matt wall paint, lack of sound-proofing and the room smelt very strongly of air freshner. However, the main problem as far as we were concerned were the haughty and dismissive front of house staff. We had a problem involving the reservation of a taxi and no apology was made. Rather we were treated with arrogance and derision.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yow-voyager
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Duret for a conference at the Palais du Congres at the nearby Concorde. I chose the hotel mostly for the location, but it was a great find! The price was a little more than most places I saw on the web, but it was well worth it. I walked here from the AirFrance bus stop at Concorde (very convenient <10 minute walk with my luggage). It was about 10:30 am so I waited 45 minutes for a room to be ready (not unreasonable given the early arrival). Room was great. Comfortable bed, walk-in closet, clean and well-appointed bathroom. Did not eat at the hotel, but the nearby bakery had a great selection. If you are looking for the tourist attractions, then you are just a short walk from the Metro which will give you easy access to almost any part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: fridgemagnet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel with friends at the time of our 25th wedding anniversery booking via Eurostar. The rooms are modern well appointed and very clean. We soon realised that we had easy access to the metro (5mins) and no where in this beautiful city was hard to get to. also a pleasent and easy walk to the Arc and shopping centres of Paris.
