The reception staff were exceptional and when we phoned them (whilst walking the city) to find us a good place to eat that evening they attacked the task with enthusiam and delivered a superb venue giving a synopsis of the chef and cusine. One very small criticism they should have a few more champagne glasses in the bar..silly point really. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Paris Hotel - Hotel Duret”
Reviews.Author: UrbanNomads
Reviews.Content: My husband and I can highly recommend Hotel Duret. It is in a wonderful local (yes! v. quiet) street in Paris just a few blocks away from the Arc de Triumph. The staff could not do enough for us whether it was booking at restaurant for dinner or teaching us how to order an espresso with milk on the side. In terms of design the hotel is impeccable - everything is clean, very tasteful and modern. When we first arrived in Paris we stayed one night at the Hotel Splendid Etoile but we moved the next day because the walls were paper-thin. Though the view was spectacular from this hotel we were so glad we moved to the Hotel Duret down the road. For high-speed Internet users we could also not fault the Duret - a night's stay includes Internet! Stay in room 203 if you can, it has two sets of French doors that open out onto a connected balcony - perfect! Also catch the bus (Air France stop) from/to the airport (it's opposite Hotel Splendid Etoile), for 13 euros (one way) you can't do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bon!”
Reviews.Author: Tumbler100
Reviews.Content: I have given it 4/5 because I think 5/5 should be reserved for exceptional locations. All reviews on TripAdvisor are correct. LOCATION right next to Argintine tube - Arc D Tre. is less than 5 mins walk away. We walked from the hotel to the Effiel Tower in about 15 - 20 mins. Cabs back from the sites were never much. So great location for the sights. It is also worth noting that it is in a quiet street away from the tourist town - this is good though! Great bakery a few doors down and a super market 20 metres away. DECOR Modern - well decked out with new looking furniture. All decor in the room was neat and unworn. Funky place to be. STAFF Faultless - more than helpful. CLEANINESS Faultless - could think of nothing negitive whatsoever. VALUE - Not bad. I would say though I was surprised breakfast want included for the cost. Also other hotels may have the same price with more facilities such as pools and gyms included. Might be worth booking via the web for a last minute tariff. BEST THING - it was nicely different to the places we normally stay (Hiltons, Le meridens etc) WORSE THING - Expensive food and drink (mini bar and breakfast). I'd love to see how the Duret experience could be expand with additional facilites. OVERALL Top place - book with confidence. We were a young couple looking to see the sights - not sure how it would differ if we had kids etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roblil
Reviews.Content: For reasons too boring to go into I stayed in two hotels during my recent trip (the other was the Littre nearish to the Latin Quarter for 2 nights and then the Duret for one night). The Duret may have the same stars as the Littre but it was superior. This place is fantastic as long as you arent after an old style Parisian experience as it is a trendy boutique affair. It does the boutique thing in a stylish, not garish, way. Its located 5-10 mins walk from the Arc de Trimophe but dont let that put you off (i) noise wise (its set off the main road); and (ii)tack wise (its sufficienlty away from the touristy side of that area). Argentine Metro is 2-3 mins walk away. By the way, if like me you think the location looks like it was a little outside the real centre of town (ie its NW of the Arc-dT and near the end of the metro line), then do not worry: its not really, its a great location. Sure its a bit of a walk back into say the Louvre area but thats the way to see this City: on foot (and anyway within 10-15 mins of leaving the hotel you can be there by Metro). The staff were 100% excellent: an example being that I checked out of the Littre (again, not because its bad but for the boring reasons mentioned above!) and turned up at 1030 hoping to drop my bag off....instead the receptionist ensured I had a room I could check into there and then.....this set the tone, nothing was too much trouble and the professionalism of the woman on the desk was A1. Nice little bar area to relax with the ample papers (no tabloids!) they provide. Our room (the first on the price level) was small but clean with superior bathroom products by the way (not the mass produced usual hotel stuff) ONLY gripe (and it didnt bother me but it will some) and this is a word of warning to Duret should they read this, is that there was a LITTLE evidence of wear and tear (eg small chip off the wardrobe door, a little sucffing on the wall). BUT please NB this was slight and not enought to make you think about checking other hotels: its just a warning to them to keep their eye on the ball and ensure this lovely hotel doesnt slip (Room 204 by by the way Duret!). The street (Rue Duret) is charming with a handful of tasteful shops and a couple of ok-ish bars/cafes back at the end of the road near the main drag. I took a nice walk left out of the hotel over the main road and up to 'Victor Hugo' metro where there is a a nice buzz and a couple of good cafes for breakfast....its then only about 10 mins to the Trocadero and a great view of the Eiffel Tower, so a good launch pad for walking back into the real centre of town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fjg971
Reviews.Content: Excellent boutique hotel. Quiet street near Arc de Triomph. Room was clean, but small. Bathroom was a nice size. The staff was friendly. The hotel is nice for people who like to be steps from the lobby and street. There are 4 or 5 rooms per floor and they are different sizes. Our friends were given a room that looked like something on a cruise ship. The shower stall was the size of a stand up tanning booth. We stayed in 304 and that stack of rooms provided nice size bathrooms and good walking space around the bed. The hotel had a very contemporary feel and was pleasing to the eye. Very "W" like. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: steverosbots
Reviews.Content: We picked Duret because it was rated #3 for Paris hotels. Three cheers for #3. The room was comfortable, the bed was great, all very clean. The staff was superb, the breakfast excellent, worth the 15 euros. Also, if you are a metro maven, the Argentine stop, a short walk away, gains access to the entire city. Staying at the Duret also exposed us to the 16th A., which we had not frequented in past visits. There were terrific restaurants and good walking, although the Bois de Boulogne, close by, is nice but no Central Park. We would definitely return to the Duret.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Kirouac
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! The location was perfect! You are about a mile from the Arc and Champs-Elysees, so you can walk there from the hotel. Also, very close to the Metro station. Very clean and neat. The manger of the hotel was so helpful and wonderful. He directed us on which metro to take as well as offered up some wonderful choices for dinner. He was more then happy to make reservations of get anything we needed. This is truly a gem, and I would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: BayswaterBabe
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel!! My boyfriend took me for my birthday as a surprise and it was perfect. We stayed in a room on the top floor which was lovely. I loved the decor, very modern and very Paris. Breakfast was lovely and we had it delivered to our room each day. The hotel recommended a restaurant to us and that was also superb. The staff were friendly and both checking in and out was quick and efficient. The location is fantastic, just off a little Paris street near the Arch de Triomphe and just up the road from the closest metro station. There are plenty of little shops on the road and it didn't feel touristy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: CD001
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excatly as the reviews stated - clean, comfortable modern. Standard room was a bit small, so we upgraded to superior for an additional 20 euros. Hotel was quiet due to it's location, about 5-10 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe, perfect for sleeping. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: FCDC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Duret for three nights in late May of 2006 and again for 3 nights in mid June of the same year. We also stayed at quality hotels in Rome and London on the same trip. The hotel Duret was by far the best of the bunch. The location was good (we could walk past the Arc De Triomph to the Eiffel Tower in about 30 minutes). The staff were very friendly, even providing local dining tips that actually panned out. The standard room that we had was very large by comparison with the others we stayed at. The entire building has recently been completely renovated and was fabulously done. The A/C was as cold as you could want, and quite quite. It was an easy walk from the nearest underground station even with luggage. The bed was huge and comfortable. The bathroom understated elegance (as was the whole room). There is a (French-launguage) PC free for guest use. It is not particularly cheap to stay here, but if you want hastle-free gauranteed comfort, this is the place. If I went back I would go there in a heartbeat. Make sure you contact "Christine" for any help that you need there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, thin walls!!!!”
Reviews.Author: immurray
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location. A two minute walk to metro and a five minute walk to the RER. Five minutes from Arc and fifteen to Eiffel tower, ten minutes to Champs Elysee. The staff were very helpful and cheerful which was nice to come back to after dealing with grumpy staff in other places!! Did not try food as it was overpriced in my eyes. Italian restaurant CONVIVIUM was very nice and only ten minutes away (Place Victor Hugo). Rooms were good, clean,big enough to sleep in!! The walls however were very thin and we had one night especially when we had to approach the neighbours!! The rooms seem to have a smoky smell but only during the night so blast the heat and open the french doors!!! I would recommend the hotel as a good base in general but others might tick more boxes.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Duret was intimate and the staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: mmb6
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Duret was a romantic getaway for my boyfriend and myself. From the moment we arrived the front desk was very knowledgeable to all our needs. The Duret is a small boutique hotel which is very warm an intimate for a couple whom don't want to be bothered with bigger chain hotels with a lot of people and families. It's off the mainstream which is nice so you can actually sleep at night, but a close enough walk to whatever you may need. I will definately book here again and highly recommend to anyone traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Other reviews overrated”
Reviews.Author: loumurphy
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for my Sister and I as a special treat after reading the reviews. Had a deluxe room which I felt was quite pricey but because of the reviews on this sight felt I was going to get what I paid for. The room (requested a twinbedded room) was on the top floor and very small with not much space to hang our clothes (by the way we only went for 3 nights). Very handy for the airfrance bus from Charles de Gaulle airport. Room very dusty and bathroom very small. The bathrobes provided were extra large which drowned my sister and I , considering the French by and large are petite ,thought this was a great insult. The breakfast was an additional optionand it was inadequate and overpriced and the service was dreadful as the only waiter was also doing all the in room breakfasts whilst trying to keep up with restocking the very uninteresting breakfast selection and providing drinks. The hotel was in a quiet street t but miles away from anywhere except the Arc de Triomphe. If you want to walk from here to see the sights forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Quiet, Spacious Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Peb116
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on the reviews and were not disappointed. Our trip to Paris was an overnight side trip so we really only needed a safe, clean and quiet place to sleep. We arrived early, but were checked in immediately. It's a small hotel, I think only four rooms on our floor. And the elevator is small. But our room was very nice and spacious. It even had a semi-private wall between our bed and the sofabed where our 8-year-old slept. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. It's not in the heart of Paris, about a 10-minute walk from the Arch, but it's within walking distance to the subway (but we did not use) and to the tour bus (which we did take). To help manage expectations, there's not a lot of restaurants or a lot to do in this area or the hotel, but if you're looking for a quiet place to sleep, a clean place to shower and to conveniently store your luggage with a pleasant staff (which the front desk happily did while we toured Paris after we checked out), I would highly recommend this hotel. We plan to come back for a longer period of time on our next trip, and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Blondiehood
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Duret based on reviews on Travel Advisor. The Duret lived up to its reputation here. We booked our standard room through Hotel in January for 4 days in April 2006. We arrived at 10 am as we had an early flight. The room was not ready and the front desk clerk graciously took our bags and upgraded us to a room on the 6th floor with a tub. I knew I was going to need to soak my aching feet every night. We spent out first day in Paris sight seeing and arrived back at the Duret at 7 pm. Our bags had been taken to our room. The room was small but well designed and beautifully decorated. The view from our window was of an apartment building across the street but the every window box was full of flowers. It was a charming room and lovely area of town. Some here on Travel Advisor say that the 16th is the wrong side of the Arc to stay in but I disagree. It is clean and safe and there are many convenient businesses ie, ATM, bakery, flower shop, produce stand, etc. The walk to the Argentine metro on line 1 is 3 minutes. You can get anywhere in Paris very quickly. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel preferring to get morning pastry and chocolate on the way to the metro on the corner of Rue Duret and Grand Armee. One day we walked to the Arc and down Champs Elysee. It is breathe taking. Everyone working at the hotel was gracious and willing to give advise and directions. We especially appreciated all Christine did to make our stay in Paris memorable. We requested and were given a non smoking room. I did smell a faint odor but only in the middle of the night through the vent in the bathroom. Otherwise there was not other problem. They have a small refrigerator in the room actually a mini bar. It was not completely full and we did cool some of our water bottles in this way. Over all it was an excellent choice. I would definitely stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Duret
HotelInfo.Address: 30, rue Duret, 75116 Paris, France
